hero.name: Márton Varga
hero.title: Mathematics Exam Preparation and Private Tutoring
hero.email_list_title: For more information, subscribe to my newsletter.
hero.myself_description_one: My name is Márton Varga, a 22-year-old recent graduate in economics. I have been actively engaged in education since the start of university, teaching and preparing dozens of students annually for central entrance exams, intermediate and advanced-level high school graduation exams, as well as university midterms. While my main focus remains on advanced-level graduation exams and university-level mathematics courses, I feel that over the years I have developed methods, techniques, and practices that make it possible to tackle even the trickiest tasks of the 8th-grade central entrance exam and the intermediate-level graduation exam. I have also created two schedules/syllabi that can prepare students for both exams, even those who generally do not enjoy or feel confident in mathematics.
hero.myself_description_two: The demand for my lessons has inspired me to make them accessible to a broader range of students without compromising their effectiveness. Therefore, starting from the upcoming fall semester, I will offer intensive, small-group preparation courses (6-8 students) for the latter two exams. Naturally, I am also happy to continue working with students who prefer one-on-one tutoring and preparation. You can find more detailed information about my lessons and courses under the relevant tabs. If you are interested, please subscribe to my newsletter.

individual_classes.individual_classes_description_one: I offer mathematics tutoring, consultations, and remedial lessons for upper primary and high school students. I also prepare students for the 8th-grade central entrance exams and the intermediate and advanced-level graduation exams. At the university level, I can assist you with courses such as Calculus 1, Calculus 2, Analysis, Probability Theory, Linear Algebra, Economic Mathematics, Statistics, and Econometrics. I have taught students from institutions like Budapest Business School, Metropolitan University, Óbuda University, Corvinus University, and Budapest University of Technology and Economics. Additionally, I provide instruction in English or German course materials, including teaching in English. I have prepared students for Austrian and German graduation exams (the former in English, the latter in Hungarian).
individual_classes.individual_classes_description_two: Individual consultations allow me to assess the student’s knowledge, identify uncertainties and gaps, and fully tailor my teaching to their needs and pace, guiding them towards their goals. I offer lessons both online and in person. While I am flexible regarding online platforms, in-person sessions are held exclusively at my quiet apartment, conveniently located within walking distance from Keleti Railway Station and the City Park.
individual_classes.individual_course_duration: The duration of a consultation is 45 minutes.
individual_classes.individual_course_price: The consultation fee is 5000 HUF per 45 minutes, whether online or in person.

small_group_courses.small_group_courses_description: I also offer group preparation courses for the 8th-grade central entrance exam and the intermediate-level graduation exam, consisting of 6-8 students. These courses are designed to intensively prepare students for the exams by focusing on typical exam tasks, progressing through various topics within a 10-week program. Information about the possible time slots for the courses preparing for the 8th-grade entrance exam will be posted on this platform at the end of summer, with registration opening from August 31.
small_group_courses.small_group_courses_duration: The course consists of one 90-minute session per week for 10 weeks
small_group_courses.small_group_courses_base_price: Regular price: 60,000 HUF (3,000 HUF per session)
small_group_courses.small_group_courses_discounted_price: Discounted price: 50,000 HUF if registered by September 30 (2,500 HUF per session)

myself.description1: I graduated from Petőfi Sándor High School in 2021. During my high school years, I developed a strong interest in languages and mathematics, which led me to pursue further studies in economics. I continued my education at Corvinus University of Budapest, where I completed my Bachelor’s degree in Applied Economics with honors. During my university years, I was a member of the Special Financial Mathematics Student Organization, where I took several courses related to this field each year.
myself.description2: Together with a classmate, I wrote a thesis for the Scientific Student Association competition in the statistics and econometrics section, and our work was nominated by the jury for the national round. Additionally, I worked as a teaching assistant in econometrics for two semesters, helping with grading assignments and conducting review sessions to prepare students for exams.
myself.description3: I have been involved in teaching mathematics since the start of my university studies, and during the summers, I also work on decoration projects, primarily for events. In my free time, I enjoy spending time with my family and friends, as well as engaging in sports. Up until high school graduation, I played basketball competitively, but now I prefer running and swimming. I often spend summers at our family vacation home in the Danube Bend; there, I find true relaxation and rejuvenation in gardening, barbecuing with friends, and playing ping pong.
